## Description {#details}

ECValue - The <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/equivalenceclasses">EquivalenceClasses</a> data structure is just a set of these.

Each of these represents a relation for a value. First it stores the value itself, which provides the ordering that the set queries. Next, it provides a &quot;next pointer&quot;, which is used to enumerate all of the elements in the unioned set. Finally, it defines either a &quot;end of list pointer&quot; or &quot;leader pointer&quot; depending on whether the value itself is a leader. A &quot;leader pointer&quot; points to the node that is the leader for this element, if the node is not a leader. A &quot;end of list pointer&quot; points to the last node in the list of members of this list. Whether or not a node is a leader is determined by a bit stolen from one of the pointers.

Definition at line 71 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/equivalenceclasses-h">EquivalenceClasses.h</a>.
